description.value:
Aura 10

Enemies in the aura cannot willingly teleport, and they take a -2 penalty to saving throws. Flying enemies in the aura cannot hover, and the aura is difficult terrain for them.
Any dazing, dominating, or stunning effect on Baba Yaga ends at the start of her turn.

Basic Attack

At-Will ✦ weapon, teleportation

Standard

Attack: Melee 1 (one creature)

+32 vs. AC

Hit: 4d8 + 18 damage, and Baba Yaga teleports the target up to 5 squares.

Recharge 5-6 ✦ force

Standard

Attack: Close blast 3 (enemies in the blast)

+30 vs. Fortitude

Hit: 3d10 + 9 force damage, and the target is immobilized and takes ongoing 15 force damage (save ends both).

First Failed Saving Throw: The target is instead restrained and takes ongoing 25 force damage (save ends both).

Recharge when Baba Yaga spends an action point ✦ polymorph, psychic

Standard

Attack: Ranged 5 (one or two creatures)

+30 vs. Fortitude

Hit: 4d10 + 8 psychic damage, and the target transforms into a Tiny toad or Small pig (save ends). Its equipment becomes part of its new form and cannot be used. While in the form, the target cannot attack and has vulnerable 10 to all damage. The effect ends if the target takes damage.

Miss: Half damage, and the target grants combat advantage until the end of Baba Yaga's next turn.

system.rechargeCondition: when Baba Yaga spends an action point

description.value:
At-Will(1/round) ✦ teleportation) At-Will (1/round

Move

Effect: Baba Yaga teleports up to 5 squares and uses broomstick.

At-Will(1/round) ✦ charm, gaze, psychic) At-Will (1/round

Minor

Attack: Ranged 10 (one creature Baba Yaga can see)

+30 vs. Will

Hit: Baba Yaga slides the target up to 5 squares, and the target makes a basic attack as a free action against a creature of Baba Yaga's choice. The target can refuse to make the attack. If the target does so or its basic attack misses, it takes 3d10 + 20 psychic damage and falls prone.

At-Will ✦ healing

Triggered

Trigger: Baba Yaga takes fire damage.

Effect (No Action): Baba gains 25 temporary hit points. If the fire damage reduces Baba Yaga to 0 hit points, she does not die and is instead removed from play until the start of her next turn, and all effects on her end. When she returns, she appears in an unoccupied space within 10 squares of her original space, and she has 50 hit points.

At-Will ✦ fear, necrotic, psychic

Triggered

Trigger: An enemy within 10 squares of Baba Yaga deals damage to her.

Attack (Immediate Reaction): Close burst 10 (triggering enemy in the burst)

+30 vs. Will

Hit: 3d10 + 20 necrotic and psychic damage, and the target falls prone.

system.biography:
HP 984; Bloodied 492Init +17 | AP 2 | Save +5
AC 41Fort 38Ref 40Will 39
Speed 7, teleport 10
Ability ScoresStr 20 (+18)
Con 22 (+19)		Dex 19 (+17)
Int 26 (+21)		Wis 24 (+20)
Cha 25 (+20)
Languages Common, Elven, Giant
Alignment Evil
Skills Arcana +26, Bluff +25, Insight +25, Nature +25Senses Blindsight 10
Passive Perception 30 | Insight 35

Equipment broomstick, robes.

Traits
